alert.note: Alert for Central Yampa River Basin (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 31 at 6:24PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Moffat County through 700 PM MDT... At 624 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southwest of Craig, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Moffat County, including the following locations... Hamilton. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 40 in Colorado between mile markers 81 and 83. Colorado 13 between mile markers 63 and 84. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
